attachments.title: How Universal Orlando's New Haunted House Is Pushing VR Tech To Its Limits
attachments.text: At Universal Studios Florida, a temporary haunted house contains one of the most sophisticated uses of consumer-facing VR anywhere. Headset-wearing guests are given agency to freely roam through a large physical space. Their movements are captured by motion-capture cameras and then translated into a shared digital environment. As VR teases the possibility of bringing physically disparate people together in order to create a sense of closeness, this haunted house represents the bleeding edge.
attachments.fallback: Forbes: How Universal Orlando's New Haunted House Is Pushing VR Tech To Its Limits
